body_html:
I've been working on this on and off for a few days- the one thing that I'm getting hung up on is the goal functionality for string data types. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I'm not sure the base one_hot operation supports strings. Running the current implementation of one_hot, I get the following error:

>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> sess = tf.Session()
>>> a = tf.one_hot([1,0,2],3,"1","0")
>>> sess.run(a)
...
tensorflow.python.framework.errors.InvalidArgumentError: No OpKernel was registered to support Op 'OneHot' with these attrs
     [[Node: OneHot_1 = OneHot[T=DT_STRING, axis=-1](OneHot_1/indices, OneHot_1/depth, OneHot_1/on_value, OneHot_1/off_value)]]

I'll update the code that I have for review once I finish writing a few tests.

body:
I've been working on this on and off for a few days- the one thing that I'm getting hung up on is the goal functionality for string data types. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I'm not sure the base one_hot operation supports strings. Running the current implementation of one_hot, I get the following error:

```
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> sess = tf.Session()
>>> a = tf.one_hot([1,0,2],3,"1","0")
>>> sess.run(a)
...
tensorflow.python.framework.errors.InvalidArgumentError: No OpKernel was registered to support Op 'OneHot' with these attrs
     [[Node: OneHot_1 = OneHot[T=DT_STRING, axis=-1](OneHot_1/indices, OneHot_1/depth, OneHot_1/on_value, OneHot_1/off_value)]]
```

I'll update the code that I have for review once I finish writing a few tests.
